alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Koolau Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued January 11 at 3:30AM HST until January 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... .A series of northwest and north swells will arrive and pass around the islands the next couple of days with both swells peaking on Friday. These swells coming in during early morning high tide times will cause additional wave run-up and likely produce minor to localized moderate coastal flooding both Friday and Saturday mornings. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, surf peaking at 18 to 22 feet along north facing shores, 10 to 15 feet along west facing shores. For the Coastal Flood Statement, minor to localized moderate low lying coastal flooding during times of high tide. * WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, north and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai...north shores of Maui. For the Coastal Flood Statement, any low lying flood prone coastal location. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from noon today until 6 AM HST Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Statement, ongoing through 6 AM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of beaches that are normally dry, minor coastal erosion, and saltwater inundation. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous. Submit your coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org
info.instruction: Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Move electronics, vehicles or other valuables to higher ground. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and watch out for overwash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches. Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
